title: MCP Auto-Connect Reliability Blocks Multi-Agent Testing

comment:
REVIEW FINDING: NON-COMPLIANT (1 deficiency)

VERIFIED ITEMS (PASS):
- Frontmatter: title = 'MCP Auto-Connect Reliability Blocks Multi-Agent Testing' (present, non-empty)
- Frontmatter: revision_summary = 'Initial draft' (appropriate for v0.1 per SOP-001 Section 5.1)
- All 8 required VAR sections present per SOP-004 Section 9A.3 (Variance Identification, Detailed Description, Root Cause, Variance Type, Impact Assessment, Proposed Resolution, Resolution Work, VAR Closure)
- Scope Handoff per SOP-004 Section 9A.5: parent accomplishments listed, VAR absorption stated, 'No scope items are lost' confirmed
- Parent traceability: CR-056 (v1.2, IN_EXECUTION) confirmed; EI-6 exists in parent and references this VAR
- VAR Type 1 designation consistent between VAR Section 1 and parent CR-056
- No placeholder content (TBD/TODO/FIXME/XXX) in pre-approved sections
- Formatting consistent throughout; section numbering sequential
- Executable block placeholders appropriate per SOP-004 Section 5 (PRE_APPROVED state)

DEFICIENCY REQUIRING CORRECTION:
1. Section 3 (Root Cause), item 2: Grammatical error -- 'ASGI middleware attempts to fix headers made things worse' is not a well-formed sentence. The clause structure is broken; it reads as if 'attempts to fix headers' is both a noun phrase and part of a verb clause simultaneously. Suggest revising to something like 'ASGI middleware that attempted to fix headers made things worse' or restructuring for clarity.

RE-REVIEW FINDING: COMPLIANT

VERIFIED ITEMS (ALL PASS):
- Frontmatter: title = 'MCP Auto-Connect Reliability Blocks Multi-Agent Testing' (present, non-empty)
- Frontmatter: revision_summary = 'Initial draft' (appropriate for v0.1 initial creation)
- All 8 required VAR sections present per SOP-004 Section 9A.3
- Scope Handoff per SOP-004 Section 9A.5: parent accomplishments listed, VAR absorption stated, 'No scope items are lost' confirmed
- Parent traceability: CR-056 (v1.2, IN_EXECUTION) confirmed; EI-6 exists and references this VAR
- VAR Type 1 designation consistent between VAR and parent
- No placeholder content (TBD/TODO/FIXME/XXX) in pre-approved sections
- Executable block placeholders appropriate per SOP-004 Section 5
- No typos or grammatical errors found
- Formatting consistent throughout; section numbering sequential 1-9

PREVIOUS DEFICIENCY RESOLVED:
- Section 3, item 2: Corrected from 'ASGI middleware attempts to fix headers made things worse' to 'ASGI middleware that attempted to fix headers made things worse' -- grammatically correct relative clause. Verified at line 42.

Document is compliant and ready for pre-approval routing.
